Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Considerably \Con*sid"er*a*bly\, adv. In a manner or to a degree not trifling or unimportant; greatly; much. [1913 Webster]
The breeds . . . differ considerably from each other. --Darwin. [1913 Webster]

considerably adv : to a great extent or degree; "I'm afraid the film was well over budget"; "painting the room white made it seem considerably (or substantially) larger"; "the house has fallen considerably in value"; "the price went up substantially" [syn: {well}, {substantially}]
